meanings.definition: Calvadoses: plural form of calvados, a type of apple brandy
meanings.sent1: At the party, they enjoyed sipping on calvadoses.
meanings.sent2: The bartender recommended trying different calvadoses from France.
meanings.sent3: The calvadoses on the shelf looked like a colorful apple army.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of calvadoses filled the room like a sweet apple cloud.
meanings.sent5: She could taste the rich history in each sip of the calvadoses.

meanings.definition: Calvadoses: third person singular present of the verb calvados, meaning to drink calvados
meanings.sent1: He calvadoses every evening after work.
meanings.sent2: She calvadoses with friends on special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to calvadoses milk when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: The river calvadoses through the valley, refreshing everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The music made her want to calvadoses and dance all night.

meanings.definition: Calvadoses: plural form of calvados, a type of apple brandy from the Calvados region of France
meanings.sent1: The store imported various calvadoses from France.
meanings.sent2: In Normandy, locals take pride in their traditional calvadoses.
meanings.sent3: The calvadoses in the cellar whispered stories of orchards and barrels.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with hues reminiscent of calvadoses.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the calvadoses transported him to the apple orchards of Calvados.
